Key Match Events: Ecuador won 1-2 against Venezuela on June 22, 2024, at Levi's Stadium
Pre-Game Insights: Ecuador have finished fourth on two previous occasions in the Copa America, while Venezuela's best performance was in 2011, when they finished in fourth position.
Both teams have not had much to choose between them in their recent meetings, with both winning one of their last six matches, and the other four games ending in draws.
Post-Match Reflections: There is not an awful lot to choose between these two sides, and we are expecting a close match on Saturday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ecuador have made a positive start to their 2026 World Cup qualification section, collecting eight points from six matches.
Venezuela have also made a solid start to their 2026 World Cup qualification campaign, sitting fourth, one point and one spot above Ecuador.
Others: Ecuador's starting lineup included Dominguez, Preciado, Torres, Pacho, Hincapie, Ortiz, Caicedo, Yeboah, Paez, Sarmiento, and Valencia.
Venezuela's starting lineup included Romo, Navarro, Makoun, Angel, Gonzalez, Casseres, Martinez, Herrera, Savarino, Rondon, and Soteldo.
